result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Scott Avery

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Randy Scott Avery in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Randy Scott Avery.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. State calls 22CF288 and 22CF354. In both files, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Notes there has been receipt of proposal from the State, would like time to make counter offer. State is in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:57 AM Defendant Randy Scott Avery in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Randy Scott Avery.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. 
State calls first witness. Witness sworn and testified. Joel Markon, Detective with SPD, July 21, 2022. Superior, Douglas Co, WI. Witness identifies Defendant. Court reflects identification of defendant. Attorney cross examines witness. Objection, relevance, overruled. State rests. 
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Defendant Randy Scott Avery appeared by video, in custody.  Michael Hoffman appears with Defendant. Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Address verified. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing. 
State requests $750 cash, no contact with S.L.N.W. Cites priors. 
Hoffman indicates lifelong resident of St. Louis County, MN. Currently unemployed. No money to post.
Court orders $750 cash, conditions of no contact with S.L.N.W.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
